meanings.definition: Rhythmic throbbing in arteries caused by the beating of the heart.
meanings.sent1: I felt my pulse quicken when I saw the scary movie.
meanings.sent2: The doctor checked my pulse to see how fast my heart was beating.
meanings.sent3: The music was so loud that it felt like my pulse was dancing to the beat.
meanings.sent4: The pulse of the city could be felt in the bustling streets.
meanings.sent5: Her pulse raced with excitement as she waited for the results.

meanings.definition: A single vibration or short burst of sound, light, or electric current.
meanings.sent1: The sudden pulse of the alarm startled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The pulse of the music filled the concert hall with energy.
meanings.sent3: The pulse of the fireworks lit up the night sky with bursts of color.
meanings.sent4: The pulse of the thunder echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: Each pulse of the drum added to the rhythm of the song.

meanings.sent1: The music made me want to pulse with the beat.
meanings.sent2: His heart began to pulse faster as he ran towards the finish line.
meanings.sent3: The lights seemed to pulse in time with the music, creating a mesmerizing effect.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the sunset seemed to pulse with intensity before fading into darkness.
meanings.sent5: The waves pulse against the shore, creating a soothing rhythm.
